verses.verse: A Psalm, a Song for the sabbath day. It is a good <S%H2896><s%> thing to give thanks <S%H3034><s%> unto Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>, And to sing praises <S%H2167><s%> unto thy name <S%H8034><s%>, O Most High <S%H5945><s%>;
To show forth <S%H5046><s%> thy lovingkindness <S%H2617><s%> in the morning <S%H1242><s%>, And thy faithfulness <S%H530><s%> every night <S%H3915><s%>,
With an instrument of ten strings <S%H6218><s%>, and with the psaltery <S%H5035><s%>; With a solemn sound <S%H1902><s%> upon the harp <S%H3658><s%>.
For thou <S%H3068><s%>, Jehovah, hast made me glad <S%H8055><s%> through thy work <S%H6467><s%>: I will triumph <S%H7442><s%> in the works <S%H4639><s%> of thy hands <S%H3027><s%>.
How great <S%H1431><s%> are thy works <S%H4639><s%>, O Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>! Thy thoughts <S%H4284><s%> are very <S%H3966><s%> deep <S%H6009><s%>.
A brutish <S%H1198><s%> man <S%H376><s%> knoweth <S%H3045><s%> not <S%H3684><s%>; Neither doth a fool understand this <S%H995><s%>:

When the wicked <S%H7563><s%> spring <S%H6524><s%> as the grass <S%H6212><s%>, And when all the workers <S%H6466><s%> of iniquity <S%H205><s%> do flourish <S%H6692><s%>; It is that they shall be destroyed <S%H8045><s%> for ever <S%H5703><s%>.
But thou <S%H3068><s%>, O Jehovah, art on high <S%H4791><s%> for evermore <S%H5769><s%>.

For <S%H341><s%>, lo, thine enemies, O Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>, For <S%H341><s%>, lo, thine enemies shall perish <S%H6><s%>; All the workers <S%H6466><s%> of iniquity <S%H205><s%> shall be scattered <S%H6504><s%>.
But my horn <S%H7161><s%> hast thou exalted like the horn of the wild-ox <S%H7214><s%>: I am anointed <S%H1101><s%> with fresh <S%H7488><s%> oil <S%H8081><s%>.

Mine eye <S%H5869><s%> also hath seen <S%H5027><s%> my desire on mine enemies <S%H7790><s%>, Mine ears <S%H241><s%> have heard <S%H8085><s%> my desire of the evil-doers <S%H7489><s%> that rise up against me <S%H6965><s%>.
The righteous <S%H6662><s%> shall flourish <S%H6524><s%> like the palm-tree <S%H8558><s%>: He shall grow <S%H7685><s%> like a cedar <S%H730><s%> in Lebanon <S%H3844><s%>.
They are planted <S%H8362><s%> in the house <S%H1004><s%> of Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>; They shall flourish <S%H6524><s%> in the courts <S%H2691><s%> of our God <S%H430><s%>.
They shall still bring forth fruit <S%H5107><s%> in old age <S%H7872><s%>; They shall be full of sap <S%H1879><s%> and green <S%H7488><s%>:
To show <S%H5046><s%> that Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> is upright <S%H3477><s%>; He is my rock <S%H6697><s%>, and there is no unrighteousness in him <S%H5766><s%>.
